source:
# Check for new, updated or deleted data
- This script checks for new, updated or deleted data by checking the source data (horizon tables) against the target (odw_harmonised_db.casework tables)
- **New Data:** where an main Reference in the source does not exist in the target, then NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Updated data:** Comparison occurs on Reference Fields in source and in target where the row hash is different i.e. there is a change in one of the columns. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Deleted data:** where an Reference info in the target exists but the same identifyers don't exist in the source. DeletedData flag is set to 'Y'

## View casework_lpa_responsibility_dim_new is created

%%sql
-- Build casework_lpa_responsibility_dim_new table
-- Gets modified or deleted from source rows

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW casework_lpa_responsibility_dim_new 

     AS

-- gets data that matches of SourceID and flags that it is modified based on a row (md5) hash. Flags as "NewData"
-- gets data that is in the target but not in source. Flags as "DeletedData"

SELECT 
    CASE
        WHEN T1.LPACode IS NULL
        THEN T3.LPAResponsibilityID
        ELSE NULL
    END                             AS LPAResponsibilityID,
    T1.lpacode                      AS LPACode,
    T1.lpaname                      AS LPAName,
    T4.LPAID                        AS LPAID,
    T1.appealtype                   AS AppealType,
    T1.login                        AS Login,
    T1.employeeid                   AS EmployeeID,
    T1.caseofficername              AS CaseOfficerName,
    T1.workflow                     AS Workflow,
    T2.SourceSystemID,
    to_timestamp(T1.expected_from)  AS IngestionDate,
    NULL                            AS ValidTo,
    md5(
        concat(
            IFNULL(T1.lpacode,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.lpaname,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.appealtype,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.login,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.employeeid,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.caseofficername,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.workflow,'.')
        ))                          AS RowID, -- this hash should contain all the defining fields
    'Y'                             AS IsActive,
    T3.IsActive                     AS HistoricIsActive

FROM odw_standardised_db.horizon_lpa_responsibility T1
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.main_sourcesystem_fact T2 ON "Casework" = T2.Description AND T2.IsActive = 'Y'
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.casework_local_planning_authority_fact T4 ON T1.lpa_code = T4.LPACode AND T4.IsActive = 'Y' 
FULL JOIN odw_harmonised_db.casework_lpa_responsibility_dim T3 ON T1.lpacode = T3.LPACode AND T3.IsActive = 'Y'
WHERE
    -- flags new data        
    CASE
        WHEN T1.lpacode = T3.LPACode AND 
            md5(
                concat(
                    IFNULL(T1.lpacode,'.'),
                    IFNULL(T1.lpaname,'.'),
                    IFNULL(T1.appealtype,'.'),
                    IFNULL(T1.login,'.'),
                    IFNULL(T1.employeeid,'.'),
                    IFNULL(T1.caseofficername,'.'),
                    IFNULL(T1.workflow,'.')
                )
            ) <> T3.RowID  -- same record, changed data
        THEN 'Y'
        WHEN T3.LPACode IS NULL -- new record
        THEN 'Y'
    ELSE 'N'
    END  = 'Y'
    AND T1.LPACode IS NOT NULL
    AND T1.expected_from = (SELECT MAX(expected_from) FROM odw_standardised_db.horizon_lpa_responsibility)

# Run tests to check integrity of data by numbers
- This script checks for the total number of current codes in the harmonised table, and compare against the numbers for new data to be added and data to be set as inactive.
- **Changes tracking:** where it checks the data against active records in harmonised and compares with records to add and records to be set as inactive.
- **Changes tolerance levels:** if the total amount to be added and deleted surpasses the tolerance limit, it will interrupt the process of loading the data

# Run tests to check integrity of data by comparison of codes
- This script checks for the total list of current codes in the harmonised table, and compare against the list for new data to be added and data to be set as inactive.
- **Changes tracking:** where it checks the data against active records in harmonised and compares with records to add and records to be set as inactive.

# Dataset is created that contains changed data and corresponding target data
- This script combines data that has been updated, Deleted or is new, with corresponding target data
- View **casework_lpa_responsibility_dim_new** is unioned to the target data filter to only those rows where changes have been detected
## View casework_lpa_responsibility_dim_changed_rows is created

%%sql
-- Create new and updated dataset

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW casework_lpa_responsibility_dim_changed_rows

    AS

-- gets updated, deleted and new rows 
Select 
    LPAResponsibilityID,
    LPACode,
    LPAName,
    LPAID,
    AppealType,
    Login,
    EmployeeID,
    CaseOfficerName,
    Workflow,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive

From casework_lpa_responsibility_dim_new WHERE HistoricIsActive = 'Y' or HistoricIsActive IS NULL

    UNION ALL

-- gets original versions of updated rows so we can update EndDate and set IsActive flag to 'N'
SELECT
    LPAResponsibilityID,
    LPACode,
    LPAName,
    LPAID,
    AppealType,
    Login,
    EmployeeID,
    CaseOfficerName,
    Workflow,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
    
FROM odw_harmonised_db.casework_lpa_responsibility_dim
WHERE LPACode IN (SELECT LPACode FROM casework_lpa_responsibility_dim_new WHERE LPAResponsibilityID IS NULL) AND IsActive = 'Y';

%%sql

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW Loading_month

    AS

SELECT DISTINCT
    IngestionDate AS IngestionDate,
    to_timestamp(date_sub(IngestionDate,1)) AS ClosingDate,
    'Y' AS IsActive

FROM casework_lpa_responsibility_dim_new;

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW casework_lpa_responsibility_dim_changed_rows_final

    AS

SELECT 
    LPAResponsibilityID,
    LPACode,
    LPAName,
    LPAID,
    AppealType,
    Login,
    EmployeeID,
    CaseOfficerName,
    Workflow,
    T1.SourceSystemID,
    T1.IngestionDate,
    T1.ValidTo,
    T1.RowID,
    T1.IsActive,
    T2.ClosingDate
FROM casework_lpa_responsibility_dim_changed_rows T1
FULL JOIN Loading_month T2 ON T1.IsActive = T2.IsActive

# View casework_lpa_responsibility_dim_changed_rows is used in a merge (Upsert) statement into the target table
- **WHEN MATCHED** ON the surrogate Key (i.e. LPAResponsibilityID), EndDate is set to today -1 day and the IsActive flag is set to 'N'
- **WHEN NOT MATCHED** ON the surrogate Key, insert rows
## Table odw_harmonised_db.casework_lpa_responsibility_dim is updated

%%sql
-- merge into dim table

MERGE INTO odw_harmonised_db.casework_lpa_responsibility_dim AS Target
USING casework_lpa_responsibility_dim_changed_rows_final AS Source

ON Source.LPAResponsibilityID = Target.LPAResponsibilityID

-- For Updates existing rows

WHEN MATCHED
    THEN 
    UPDATE SET
    Target.ValidTo = to_timestamp(ClosingDate),
    Target.IsActive = 'N'

-- Insert completely new rows

WHEN NOT MATCHED 
    THEN INSERT (
        LPAResponsibilityID,
        LPACode,
        LPAName,
        LPAID,
        AppealType,
        Login,
        EmployeeID,
        CaseOfficerName,
        Workflow,
        SourceSystemID,
        IngestionDate,
        ValidTo,
        RowID,
        IsActive)
    VALUES (
        Source.LPAResponsibilityID,
        Source.LPACode,
        Source.LPAName,
        Source.LPAID,
        Source.AppealType,
        Source.Login,
        Source.EmployeeID,
        Source.CaseOfficerName,
        Source.Workflow,
        Source.SourceSystemID,
        Source.IngestionDate,
        Source.ValidTo,
        Source.RowID,
        Source.IsActive)

# Fix the IDs
- No auto-increment feature is available in delta tables, therefore we need to create new IDs for the inserted rows
- This is done by select the target data and using INSERT OVERWRITE to re-insert the data is a new Row Number
## Table odw_harmonised_db.casework_lpa_responsibility_dim is updated

%%sql
-- Insert new casework_lpa_responsibility_dim

INSERT OVERWRITE odw_harmonised_db.casework_lpa_responsibility_dim

SELECT 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY LPAResponsibilityID NULLS LAST) AS LPAResponsibilityID,
    LPACode,
    LPAName,
    LPAID,
    AppealType,
    Login,
    EmployeeID,
    CaseOfficerName,
    Workflow,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.casework_lpa_responsibility_dim;
This last cell is just to check count of rows between source and target on first load, to be deleted!
